string.text: I wish I had some painkillers for this headache. That dream didn’t help, either…
Shit! Another “gift” from the Zone! Just what I needed!
What if I try to use one of the teleporters? Maybe one of them will lead me to Scavenger?
I need to check out the basement Marcus mentioned. Maybe I can find something useful.
What was that? Was that thing real or was I hallucinating? I think I’m losing my mind…
An SOS. Strange. Do we have another “guest”? I should check it out.
Damn it, Marcus. Where have you gone off to?
Rest in peace, Sledgehammer.
Fucking hell… This anomaly never fails to surprise me.
Is this really it? Are we finally free from this godforsaken place?
I should check the arch-anomaly later. Perhaps I might find some valuable artifacts there.
I hate that tunnel…
God damn it. My head feels like it’s about to explode.
Raccoon might be able to help me complete the contract. I should go talk to him.
I should go pay Raccoon a visit. I think he can help me out with this mission.
Besides a bunch of random personal notes, this notebook contains coordinates of some kind. I should check it out.
What the hell? Why am I in this cage?
All right, let’s find Lefty. Where would I go if I’d just killed my friend?
I should inspect the surroundings when I have the time.
Damn it, Lefty… Who could have done this? I should search the hangar. Perhaps the murderer left some kind of clue.
One wrong move and I’ll fall off…
I gave you a chance to leave peacefully! Now you’ll rot in here for eternity!
Get out of my head!
You can’t break me!
Damn it. This place is swarming with bloodsuckers… I need to stay quiet.
I’ll avenge Savage’s death… I’ll make that creature pay!
I need to blow the entrance shut so that creature won’t follow me out.
Goodbye, Hermit.

During the afternoon, Hunter and I went on our way, and after a few hours, we were already at the bar. By the time we reached it, it was already dark, so Hunter suggested we get some rest and head off to the Cordon next thing in the morning. The story’s not over yet, though…

Alas, I wake up not in the bar but in the Lair. In front of me, I see a panicked Marcus, and with each moment, my memories of the past slowly fade away. Stronglav won’t release me from his net so easily. He’s playing with me, keeping me trapped inside some kind of time loop, restarting it over and over. Unfortunately, I won’t be able to remember how I got out of here previously; my memories fade away with a headache. I cannot leave this time loop while the creature is alive, but I will find a way. I promise!

I don’t know what happened after my conversation with Marcus, but when I come to, I find myself in the Lair. In front of me, I see a panicked Marcus, and with each moment, my memories of the digger station and the Outpost fade away. Stronglav won’t release me from his net so easily. He needs me—or rather, my body—and he’s keeping me trapped inside some kind of time loop, restarting it over and over, until I give in. But I won’t give in, and I will find a way to kill that creature. I promise!

Listen up, Mosquito: take Beast with you and hurry on over to the zombies. We need to eliminate them at all costs, or they’ll overrun the base in minutes. Use all the ammo you have left—Beast has supplied us with additional magazines. I hope you come out in one piece.
Beast, can you hear me? I’ll try to talk to the base leader. He should free you. Just don’t do anything stupid in the meantime. See you later!
Are you ready? Then take the lead while I cover you from behind.
I think that’s the last of them. Check the bodies; we need everything we can get right now.
